intro: Acrostichum semipinnatifidum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often divided. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with five petals, typically blooming during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found near streams or in dense forest undergrowth. Its unique leaf structure and vibrant flowers make it a distinctive species in its native habitat.
